translation: Foshuo jiezhu fangdeng lue jing one volume

source_sentence: 西晉月氏三藏竺法護譯
translation: Translation of the Tripiṭaka of the Yuezhi Family of the Western Jin Dynasty by Zhu Fahou

source_sentence: 聞如是：一時佛遊王舍城靈鷲山，與大比丘眾俱，比丘六萬、菩薩八十億、摩竭國中眾優婆塞六百萬。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha traveled to the Vulture Mountain in Rājagṛha with a great assembly of monks, 60,000 monks, 8 billion bodhisattvas, and 6 million laymen from the country of Maghā.

source_sentence: 臨滅度時最後末年至羅閱祇，初首新歲。
translation: When he was about to die, he arrived at Rājagṛha in the last year, at the beginning of a new year.

source_sentence: 於時，世尊即如其像三昧正受，莊嚴於斯三千大千世界，懸繒幡綵竪諸幢蓋，散華燒香布諸蓮華，其葉百千。
translation: The Bhagavān then took refuge in the samādhi of his image and adorned the 3,000,000 great worlds with silken banners, banners, banners, banners, scattering flowers, burning incense, and spreading lotus flowers with a hundred thousand leaves.

source_sentence: 三千世界億億梵天王，各與無央數億百千眷屬往詣佛所，稽首足下，退住一面，叉手自歸。
translation: Billions of brahma kings from each of the three thousand worlds went to the Buddha with an incalculable number of hundreds of thousands of their retinues, bowed their heads at their feet, withdrew to one side, and saluted with their palms together.

source_sentence: 此大千界淨居身天，威靈尊勢大神妙天王、諸龍王、鬼神王、阿須倫王、迦留羅王、真陀羅王、摩睺勒王，各與無數億百千官屬往詣佛所，稽首足下，却住一面，叉手自歸。
translation: In this great chiliocosm, the gods of the pure abode, the great gods of imposing dignity and great supernormal power, the dragon kings, the demon kings, the king of asuras, the king of garuḍas, the king of mahule, and the king of mahule each went to the Buddha with measureless hundreds of millions of officials, bowed their heads at their feet, withdrew to one side, and returned with their palms together.

source_sentence: 其於十方各江沙等諸佛世界，神聖殊絕、巍巍高節菩薩大士來詣佛所，稽首足下，遷住一面，叉手自歸。
translation: In all the buddha-worlds of the ten directions, there are Bodhisattvas and mahāsattvas of unparalleled dignity and lofty stature who come to the Buddha, bow their heads at their feet, move to one side, and fold their arms as they make their way home.

source_sentence: 諸來會者應時周遍於此三千大千世界，極於上界三十二天，無有空缺——間不容杖、鍼不得入——靡不稠密。
translation: Those who come to meet him should then circumambulate these 3,000 great thousand worlds, reaching as far as the thirty-two heavens of the upper realms, where there's nothing vacant - no stick or needle can fit between them - and they're all dense.

source_sentence: 大神無極天、龍、鬼、神、阿須倫、迦留羅、真陀羅、摩睺勒各各住立，瞻佛尊顏。
translation: The great gods, the peerless gods, dragons, ghosts, spirits, asuras, garuḍas, maṇḍalas, and mahoras each stand and look at the Buddha's venerable face.

source_sentence: 其身各異，其心同一，釋棄因緣，等心歸佛。
translation: Their bodies were different, but their minds were the same, and they abandoned their causes and conditions and returned to the Buddha with one mind.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊安然庠序從三昧起，三返觀察諸來眾會。
translation: At that point, the Bhagavān calmly and quietly rose from his samādhi and returned three times to examine the congregation of comers.

source_sentence: 三返觀已，三返自察師子頻申。
translation: After observing them three times, he checked himself three times to see how often the lion sang.

source_sentence: 三頻申已，三返出舌。
translation: After three repetitions, he returned three times and spoke out his tongue.

source_sentence: 三出舌已，三返以舌覆三千大千世界，靡不周遍，光明煌煌照於十方。
translation: After he had spoken three times, he covered the 3,000 great thousand worlds with his tongue three times, completely pervading them, and his light shone brilliantly in the ten directions.

source_sentence: 於是，大聖還縮其舌，重復顧眄諸來會者。
translation: The great sage then retracted his tongue and looked again at those who had come to the meeting.

source_sentence: 諸來會者僉然起住，稽首作禮自歸命佛。
translation: The assembled people all rose up together, bowed their heads in homage, and gave their lives to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告於彌勒菩薩大士：「阿逸！
translation: At that point, the Bhagavān addressed the Bodhisattva Maitreya, "Ayi!

source_sentence: 仁識知之，正覺不久當取滅度。
translation: You know, sir, that you're correctly aware that you'll soon attain extinction.

source_sentence: 欲有所問，今是其時，應宜諮請。
translation: They want to ask questions, and now is the right time to ask them.

source_sentence: 諸有疑結、志不解者，前質如來，無得後悔：『面值大聖，何不決之？』」
translation: Anyone who has a bond of doubt or a wish they don't understand will be able to confront the Tathāgata without regret: 'At face value, great sage, why don't you resolve this?'"

source_sentence: 彌勒菩薩前白佛言：「世尊知時，明徹六通諸度無極，靡不宣暢決一切疑。
translation: Maitreya said to the Buddha, "When the Bhagavān knew this, his insight into the six supernormal powers was limitless, and he could explain them all without fail and resolve any doubts.

source_sentence: 善哉，世尊！
translation: Good, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 隨時便宜頒宣經道，令斯法目永得久存。」
translation: At the appropriate time, he skillfully proclaimed the sūtras and the path, so that this Dharma eye might be permanently sustained."

source_sentence: 於是，大神妙天王與八十億淨居天人營從圍遶，行詣佛所。
translation: Thereupon, the great king of the marvelous gods and eight billion gods and humans of pure abode surrounded him and marched over to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 稽首足下，叉手自歸，前白佛言：「唯然，世尊！
translation: He bowed his head at his feet, saluted himself with his palms together, and said to the Buddha, "Yes, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 今斯經典其號名曰濟諸方等學，過去諸佛、如來、至真、等正覺之所講說。
translation: This is a scripture whose title is 'Sarvalokadhātu,' and it was taught by the buddhas, tathāgatas, the supreme truth, and the perfectly enlightened in the past.

source_sentence: 今日大聖惟當垂哀，重為散意，多所愍哀、多所安隱，使如來法訓誨久存。」
translation: Today, the great sage will only have pity on them and again scatter their thoughts, giving them much pity and much comfort so that the Tathāgata's teaching of the Dharma will endure for a long time."

source_sentence: 時佛默然，可大神妙天王所啟。
translation: The Buddha then remained silent and allowed the great, wonderful celestial king to enlighten him.

source_sentence: 天王見佛默然可已，退住一面。
translation: After the god king saw that the Buddha's silence was acceptable, he withdrew to one side.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告彌勒菩薩：「阿逸當知，諸過去如來、至真、等正覺無不講說此濟諸方等經典之要；當來、現在十方世界如來至真皆亦說是。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed Maitreya Bodhisattva, "Ayi, you should know that none of the Tathāgatas, Supreme Truths, and Fully Awakened Ones of the past did teach this essential scripture that helps in various directions, and the Tathāgatas, Supreme Truths of the present and future worlds in ten directions all teach it as well.

source_sentence: 其不宣斯，謗佛、違經、毀諸聖眾。
translation: If they don't preach this, they denigrate the Buddha, contradict the sūtras, and disparage the noble ones.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 若說此經有無益想、謂不備悉，為誹謗佛、違失經典、毀呰聖眾。
translation: If someone says this sūtra has unhelpful thoughts or says it's not complete, they're slandering the Buddha, violating the sūtras, and disparaging the noble people.

source_sentence: 毀三寶者，必歸地獄。
translation: Someone who disparages the Three Treasures will surely go to hell.

source_sentence: 是故，彌勒！
translation: Therefore, Maitreya!

source_sentence: 若族姓子及族姓女學菩薩乘，通暢諸經眾他異法，爾乃分別演眾經義。
translation: "If clansmen sons and clanswomen train in the bodhisattva vehicle and understand the many scriptures and different teachings of others, then they will discern and explain the meanings of the various scriptures.

source_sentence: 若欲周備不闕文字，隨正典教不自損己。
translation: If they want to fully comprehend them, they won't lack words, and they won't harm themselves by following the correct texts and teachings.

source_sentence: 又，仁彌勒！
translation: "Again, Ren Mile!

source_sentence: 宜當專精思惟是門，然後末世攝護正法。」
translation: You should concentrate your thoughts on this teaching, and then in the latter days you'll be able to safeguard the right teaching."

source_sentence: 彌勒應曰：「唯然，世尊！
translation: Maitreya responded, "Yes, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 誠如聖教，當傳神旨，不敢違命。」
translation: Sincerely following the noble teaching, I will transmit the divine decree and dare not disobey it."

source_sentence: 佛復告彌勒菩薩：「如來至真某日於夜得逮無上正真之道，為最正覺，至於無餘泥洹界滅度日夜，如來至真寧有缺漏，意誤忘乎？
translation: The Buddha again addressed Maitreya Bodhisattva, "One day, the Tathāgata Zhijin attained the unsurpassed true path at night and became the most perfectly enlightened one, reaching the nirvāṇa without remainder and extinguishing it day and night, how could the Tathāgata Zhijin have missed anything and mistakenly forgotten it?

source_sentence: 宣惡念非瑕疵行耶？」
translation: Is proclaiming evil thoughts not a flawed practice?"

source_sentence: 彌勒報曰：「無也，世尊！」
translation: Maitreya replied, "No, Bhagavān!"

source_sentence: 復謂阿逸：「如來某夜成最正覺，至滅度日，所可講說皆實至誠，順時應宜而無虛妄。」
translation: Again, Ayi said, "From the time the Tathāgata attained supreme perfect enlightenment one night until the day of his cessation, whatever he can teach is really sincere, appropriate to the time, and not false."

source_sentence: 佛言：「或有愚人，不別如來善權方便、不覺真實誠諦之言，反傳狂語出意自說：『此事合義，此義不合。』
translation: The Buddha said, "Perhaps there's a foolish man who doesn't distinguish the Tathāgata's skillful means and doesn't realize the true and honest truth of what he says, but instead transmits crazy words and says out loud, 'This thing fits the meaning; this meaning doesn't.'

source_sentence: 以是比類誹謗正道。
translation: Such an analogy would be to denigrate the right path.

source_sentence: 若誹謗經則為謗佛，吾謂此黨必歸地獄。」
translation: If they denigrate the sūtras, they denigrate the Buddha, and I say this group will surely go to hell."

source_sentence: 佛言彌勒：「當來末世五濁之俗，餘五十歲，當有四輩——比丘、比丘尼、優婆塞、優婆夷——志學菩薩，慕本所誓，外異學意，奉事如來。
translation: The Buddha said to Maitreya, "In the future, in the last five turbid ages, there will be four groups of people - monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen - who will train as bodhisattvas, admire their original vows, change their minds outside of training, and serve the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 見佛所說法律出家，修為沙門，謙敬種姓。
translation: Seeing the Buddha's teaching on the Dharma, they leave home, train as ascetics, and humble themselves to the lineage.

source_sentence: 其人所志惟求利養，毀壞種姓、貪嫉室家、亂其居業、面無好色、志慕小意、性不開解、不能寬泰、不壞情欲、多求汲汲；遠於一切諸法門行、三昧正定，常住諛諂，心念各異，言行不同。
translation: Their aspirations are only to seek profit, to disparage their family, to covet their home, to disrupt their activities, to lack good looks, to aspire to triviality, to be uncultivated in nature, to be unable to tolerate, to abide in flattery, to be uncorrupted in their desires, and to draw a lot of attention to themselves; they're far removed from all the practices of the Dharma profundity, samādhi, and right concentration, and they always abide in flattery, with their minds set on different things and their words and deeds different.

source_sentence: 貪其種姓依有勢者，見諸明智曉了法藏，謂之無知。
translation: Those who crave the power of their lineage and rely on it are called ignorant when they see that their wisdom is well understood by the Dharma store.

source_sentence: 己無所知，自嘆有慧；己無聰明，自歎聰智。
translation: They praise themselves as having wisdom when they don't know anything, and they praise themselves as being wise when they don't have intelligence.

source_sentence: 因猗佛道建立其意，等心眾生興發大哀，又不忘捨善權方便。
translation: As a result, they establish their intention for the Buddha's path, arouse great compassion in sentient beings of equal minds, and don't forget to abandon the skillful means of good authority.

source_sentence: 依蒙佛力而已，違越所講，信樂於其學中。
translation: Relying on the power of the Buddha, they simply go against what's taught and are confident and happy in their training.

source_sentence: 或復說言：『若有經卷說聲聞事，其行菩薩不當學此、亦不當聽。
translation: Some people also say, 'If a sūtra explains śrāvaka matters, practicing bodhisattvas shouldn't study them or listen to them.

source_sentence: 非吾等法、非吾道義，聲聞所行也，修菩薩者慎勿學彼；辟支佛法亦復如是，慎莫聽之。』」
translation: It's not our teaching, not the meaning of our path, and it's practiced by śrāvakas, so cultivating bodhisattvas should be careful not to train there; the same goes for the teachings of the solitary realizers, so be careful not to listen to them.'"

source_sentence: 佛語阿逸：「佛為信樂開化諸天，隨時說法，教諸龍、神、阿須倫、迦留羅、真陀羅、摩睺勒、犍沓和、人與非人，隨其本行，志所應脫，說法開化。
translation: The Buddha said to Ayi, "The Buddha teaches the gods, gods, asuras, garuḍas, maṇḍalas, mahorhodhas, gandharvas, humans, and nonhumans who are faithful and happy to enlighten others at any time, according to their own lineage and desire to liberate themselves, to teach and enlighten others.

source_sentence: 普至十方各江沙等，導利眾生各隨本行，隨宜當度利益眾生。
translation: They reach all the rivers and sands of the ten directions, guide sentient beings according to their own practice, and save and benefit sentient beings according to their own abilities.

source_sentence: 因斯志操頒宣經道，度脫一切皆使得道。」
translation: Because of this aspiration, he promulgates the sūtras and proclaims the path, and he liberates all of them, making them the path."

source_sentence: 佛告彌勒：「當是世時，菩薩學中志自懷結，諸菩薩中剛強難化、弊惡凶暴、妄言兩舌、尠聞智少。
translation: The Buddha told Maitreya, "In this world, bodhisattvas in training will harbor their own bonds, and among them are those who are rigid and difficult to teach, harsh and violent, lying and duplicitous, and whose knowledge of what to hear is limited.

source_sentence: 宣傳佛道別為兩分：『欲為菩薩，當學此法，不當學是。』
translation: They promoted the Buddha Way in two distinct ways: 'If you want to be a bodhisattva, you must train in this teaching; you shouldn't train in this.'

source_sentence: 而懷是心誹謗於佛、毀呰經典、鬪亂聖眾。
translation: With this kind of mind, they denigrate the Buddha, disparage the scriptures, and fight against the noble people.

source_sentence: 壽終身散便墮地獄，在彼見煮，當經無數劫痛，罪猶不畢。
translation: When their life span ends and their body is scattered, they'll fall into hell, where they'll see boiling water and go through countless eons of pain, but their crimes still won't be completed.

source_sentence: 從地獄出，當復還生貧匱之門，所當經歷眾難之患，極遠難量乃得受決。
translation: When they emerge from hell, they'll be reborn into a poor and destitute family, and they'll experience the many difficult and painful things that must be done before they can be judged.

source_sentence: 雖得受決，在五濁世乃成為佛；亦如我本遭難長遠無央數劫在五濁世成最正覺。
translation: Even though I've attained resolution, I'll become a buddha in the five turbid realms, just as I was originally afflicted by long and incalculably long eons and became the most awakened in the five turbid realms.

source_sentence: 若聞其言而信聽受、篤信思惟從其教者，亦當如是歸於惡趣。
translation: If someone hears their words and faithfully listens to them, faithfully contemplates and follows their teaching, they'll likewise return to a bad destiny.

source_sentence: 所以然者，信惡親友故遭此患。」
translation: That's why believing in bad friends and relatives gets you into this trouble."

source_sentence: 佛告阿逸：「過去久遠不可計劫，爾時有佛，號離垢[火*僉]成就功稱如來、至真、等正覺，出現於世八十姟歲，為諸眾生頒宣經道。
translation: The Buddha told Ayi, "Long ago, in an incalculable eon, there was a Buddha named Licchavi [fire*] who accomplished the merit of praising the Tathāgata, the Supreme Truth, and the Completely Awakened One, appeared in the world for 80 lifetimes, and he taught the sutras and path to all sentient beings.

source_sentence: 時有比丘名淨命，為法都講。
translation: At the time, there was a monk named Jingliang who preached the Dharma for all of them.

source_sentence: 宣若干教，言辭柔軟，辯才至真，勸助發起無央數人，顯揚等教多所歡悅。
translation: He proclaimed certain teachings, spoke softly, and had the most eloquent and genuine eloquence, encouraged and motivated measureless people, and revealed such teachings that were well-pleasing to many.

source_sentence: 時離垢成就功稱如來囑累淨命比丘於後末世當護正法，囑累已後乃取滅度。
translation: The Tathāgata Licchavi accomplished the merit of praise then instructed the monk Jingliang to protect the right teaching in the latter part of his life, and after he had instructed him to do so, he then attained extinction.

source_sentence: 「如來至真滅度之後，彼比丘於億歲執法品宣佛教。
translation: "After the Tathāgata truly had ceased, that monk taught Buddhism in a class of laws that had been enforced for hundreds of millions of years.

source_sentence: 因得普入濟諸方等經典之要，宣傳道化發起一切，順諸眾生本心所樂應當解者而分別之。
translation: Because he had gained universal access to the essentials of the scriptures that help people in various directions, he promoted the Way and transformed them all, discerning what should be understood according to the original desires of sentient beings.

source_sentence: 周旋往返八萬城邑，觀察眾生本願發意，令得飽滿除去飢虛眾情之難。
translation: He travels around to 80,000 cities and towns, observing the aspirations of sentient beings in their original vows, so that they're fed and satisfied, and he removes the difficulties of hungry sentient beings.

source_sentence: 「於彼世時，有大國城，名曰仁賢。
translation: "In another time, there was a great country called Good Samaritan.

source_sentence: 有八十億眾民居中，亦觀根源而為說法。
translation: There were 8 billion people living in it, and they also observed the root cause and taught the Dharma.

source_sentence: 於時城中八十億家忻然受教，化一億家發菩薩意，七十九億立聲聞乘。
translation: Eight billion families in that city then readily accepted the teaching, teaching 100 million families to give rise to the bodhisattva aspiration and 7.9 billion to establish the śrāvaka vehicle.

source_sentence: 於是，淨命比丘與萬菩薩同心俱往詣修道處。
translation: The pure-life monk then went with all the bodhisattvas in one accord to the place of cultivation.

source_sentence: 「出去未久，時有比丘名曰為法，行來周旋，遠他鄉來。
translation: "Not long after they left, a monk named Weifa traveled around and came from a faraway land.

source_sentence: 在仁賢城奉持方等千餘經卷，現得四禪自以為遠。
translation: He had memorized more than a thousand sūtras and scrolls in the city of Renxian and had now attained the four meditation heavens, which he considered to be distant.

source_sentence: 淨命比丘學方等經十四億卷及修餘經六百萬卷。
translation: The monk of pure livelihood had studied 1.4 billion rolls of the vaipulya sūtra and cultivated 6 million rolls of other sūtras.

source_sentence: 「時法比丘在仁賢城惟但宣散一品法教，不知隨時觀其本行講說經法也；不能覺了達諸法界，專以空法而開化之，言一切法空悉無所有，所可宣講但論空法。
translation: "At the time, the Dharma monk in Renzin City was only disseminating a teaching of one class of the Dharma, not knowing that he could always observe his own practice and preach the sūtras and teach the Dharma; he couldn't awaken and comprehend the Dharma realm, so he focused on the teaching of emptiness, saying that all things are empty and lack existence, and that he could only discuss the teaching of emptiness.

source_sentence: 言無罪福，輕蔑諸行，復稱己言：『如今吾說悉佛所教。
translation: He says he has no faults or merits, despises his own activities, and again claims, 'Now, I've taught everything the Buddha has taught.

source_sentence: 淨命比丘所可演者，猗著雜碎，志性不清，為人穢濁。
translation: That monk of pure life who can preach is so attached to debris and confusion in his mind that he makes people unclean.

source_sentence: 誰本為彼比丘作字號淨命者，實不清淨。
translation: Whoever originally designated that monk as having a name of pure livelihood really isn't pure?

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 受取眾華，取眾華已而服食之；亦受名香、諸雜塗香，亦服食之。
translation: They receive and eat many flowers, and after receiving them, they also receive and eat famous and variously-coated fragrances.

source_sentence: 彼學愚冥，癡無所知。
translation: Their training is so obscure that they're deluded and don't know.

source_sentence: 吾身學來，久修梵行。
translation: I myself have been training here for a long time and have cultivated the religious practice.

source_sentence: 彼適新學而受其誡，從來未久勿得信之。』
translation: It's appropriate for a novice to accept his instructions, but he hasn't long since trusted them.'

source_sentence: 又其比丘放逸自恣，眾人橫敬，一心悅豫歸淨命比丘。
translation: That monk is careless and self-indulgent, and the people are disrespectful, so he wholeheartedly rejoices in the monk of pure livelihood.

source_sentence: 其法比丘作是謗毀、宣其惡行，眾人不信、不從其教。
translation: That Dharma monk denigrates and proclaims his bad behavior, and the people don't believe him or follow his teaching.

source_sentence: 「其法比丘用懷毒心誹謗智士，壽終之後墮地獄中，竟八十劫；用誹謗佛、毀呰正法，在地獄中七十劫已，加六十劫迷荒失志；盡斯數已，乃逮前行本發道意香寶光明如來佛所。
translation: "After he dies, that Dharma monk slanders a wise man with a venomous heart and falls into hell for 80 eons; after 70 eons in hell for slandering the Buddha and disparaging the right teaching, he goes into delusion for 60 eons after slandering the Buddha; after ending that number, he then rises to the Tathāgata Buddha's residence, where he used to practice the fragrance, jewels, and light of the path he originally intended.

source_sentence: 其佛為講，更說法義勸發道意。
translation: The Buddha then preached to them, explaining the meaning of the Dharma and encouraging them to give rise to the intention for enlightenment.

source_sentence: 墮畜生中九百萬世，後生人間六百萬世，常遭貧厄，所生之處常瘂無舌。
translation: They were cast into the animal world for 9 million lifetimes and then into the human world for 6 million lifetimes, always suffering from poverty and hardship, and the place where they were born was always dumb and tongueless.

source_sentence: 然後於世見六十三姟諸佛正覺，在諸佛所常為法師，世世所生普成五通，皆為諸佛所見教勅，悉解諸法說清淨義。」
translation: Then, in the world, they see the 63 buddhas who are correctly enlightened, are always the Dharma teacher in the buddhas' places, and all their births from generation to generation result in the five supernormal powers, which are all seen by the buddhas and taught by them, and they fully understand the teachings and explain their pure meanings."

source_sentence: 佛告阿逸：「欲知爾時淨命比丘豈異人乎？
translation: The Buddha told Āyatollah, "Would you like to know if that monk of pure life at the time was someone else?

source_sentence: 莫作斯觀。
translation: Don't contemplate it that way.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 是阿彌陀佛也。
translation: This is Amitâbha Buddha.

source_sentence: 其法比丘則我身是，吾於彼世所更如是。」
translation: That Dharma monk is myself, and I was even more so in that world."

source_sentence: 佛告阿逸：「眾事諸法難了難了，義微如是。
translation: The Buddha told Āyatollah, "The many things that are difficult to understand and difficult to comprehend have subtle meanings like this.

source_sentence: 吾以是故，於五濁世得成正覺。」
translation: It's for this reason that I attained perfect enlightenment in the five turbid realms."

source_sentence: 佛言阿逸：「若有菩薩說兩品法，因是之故，在五濁世當成佛道。
translation: The Buddha said to Ayi, "If a bodhisattva teaches two classes of the Dharma, as a result, he'll achieve the Buddhahood in the five turbid realms.

source_sentence: 又其佛土多有諸魔數數興亂，成佛道時，若宣經法亦嬈亂之。」
translation: Also, in many of those Buddha lands, Māra will repeatedly cause disruption, and when they achieve the Buddha Way, if they preach the sūtras and teachings, they'll also disturb them."

source_sentence: 當爾之時，諸來眾會咸皆郁咿流淚于面，各自說言：「莫令學人宣二品法，講說經義；勿令偏黨專愚、放恣自是、惡彼如法比丘，為諸比丘及在家學所分別說，說是非法。」
translation: At the time, the assembled people all burst into tears and said, "Don't allow students to proclaim two kinds of teachings and expound the meanings of sūtras; don't allow them to be partisan, foolish, uncaring, and self-righteous, and to teach unlawfully for the discriminations of monks and householders who are training in the Dharma."

source_sentence: 時彼會中有百菩薩，尋從座起，避席地坐，噓唏流淚。
translation: One hundred bodhisattvas in that assembly then rose from their seats, withdrew from their seats, and sat down, sobbing and weeping.

source_sentence: 於時世尊知此菩薩心念本末，故復發問：「諸族姓子！
translation: Knowing the root of this bodhisattva's thoughts, the Bhagavān then again asked, "Clansmen!

source_sentence: 何故坐地噓唏流淚？」
translation: Why are you sitting on the ground, sobbing and weeping?"

source_sentence: 即白佛言：「我等，世尊！
translation: He then said to the Buddha, "We, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 各自識察犯此殃釁。」
translation: Each consciously observes that he's violating this calamity."

source_sentence: 佛言：「如是，族姓子等所察念也。
translation: The Buddha said, "So it is, you clansmen will examine it.

source_sentence: 錠光佛時有一菩薩名曰智積，佛滅度後建為法師。
translation: When Dīpaṃkara Buddha was born, there was a bodhisattva named Jñācika who was established as a teacher of the Dharma after the Buddha's death.

source_sentence: 諸賢者等求其缺漏，從是以來未曾復與諸佛相見，不識道心、不得總持、不逮三昧。
translation: Seeking to identify their shortcomings, these good men hadn't seen the buddhas again since then, and they didn't know the mind of the path, couldn't maintain it in a holistic way, and hadn't acquired samādhi.

source_sentence: 諸族姓子前世之時亦與我俱同發道意。
translation: In a previous life, those clansmen were also with me in the determination to follow the path.

source_sentence: 「又，族姓子！
translation: "And, clansmen!

source_sentence: 是披陀劫最後有佛，名曰樓由。
translation: "At the end of the Pītā kalpa, there was a Buddha named Luyu.

source_sentence: 當於彼世乃能逮得無所從生法忍，然後三阿僧祇劫逮致無上正真之道為最正覺。
translation: In that world, he'll acquire the patience of the Dharma that arises from nothing, and then he'll acquire the unsurpassed true path of the most correct awakening in three incalculably long eons.

source_sentence: 是故，族姓子！
translation: Therefore, clansmen!

source_sentence: 菩薩菩薩展轉相見，莫生異心相求短也。
translation: When bodhisattvas and bodhisattvas see each other repeatedly, don't give rise to different mental states of seeking shortcomings.

source_sentence: 若見菩薩，當自念言：『今吾覩佛寺、見佛正覺，佛立吾前。』
translation: If you see a bodhisattva, you must think to yourself, 'Now, I've seen the Buddha's temple, I've seen the Buddha's correct awakening, and the Buddha is standing here in front of me.'

source_sentence: 假使，族姓子！
translation: Suppose, clansman!

source_sentence: 若有菩薩見餘菩薩，發起異心視不如佛，則自毀損。
translation: If a bodhisattva sees another bodhisattva who arouses dissenting views and regards them as inferior to the Buddha's, then he will slander himself.

source_sentence: 由是之故，莫懷瞋恨。
translation: For this reason, don't harbor ill will.

source_sentence: 其見初發菩薩心者，視不如佛，輒為侵欺諸佛世尊於今現在不可計數無限世界。
translation: Seeing someone who has first arisen the bodhisattva mind and regards it as inferior to the Buddha will easily deceive the buddhas and world-honored ones in an incalculably long and infinite number of worlds in which they now live.

source_sentence: 「又，族姓子！
translation: "And, clansmen!

source_sentence: 今佛預覩將來末世餘五十歲，有得總持若逮三昧，皆是如來威神所致。
translation: Now, the Buddha's vision of the remaining 50 years in the final age in the future, when there's a samādhi of mastery and arrest, is due to the Tathāgata's authoritative power.

source_sentence: 故，族姓子！
translation: Therefore, clansmen!

source_sentence: 若誹謗法師，求其短者，為謗如來。
translation: If someone denigrates a teacher of the Dharma and seeks his shortcomings, they're denigrating the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 如來滅度後，若有曉了隨時之宜，從眾生心本所信行為說法要。
translation: After the Tathāgata's death, if there's someone who understands the appropriate time to teach the essentials of the Dharma based on what sentient beings believe and do in their hearts, then you should know that this is the Tathāgata's noble teaching.

source_sentence: 若於眾會有菩薩學一發意頃，衣毛為竪；一返聞經尋即諷誦，則當知之如來聖旨之所接也。
translation: If there are bodhisattvas in the assembly who stand up with their hair on their heads as soon as they train, or who recite the sūtras as soon as they hear them, then you should know that they've been accepted by the Tathāgata's noble intention.

source_sentence: 「於彼世時有愚憃士，無菩薩行自謂菩薩。
translation: "In another world, there were foolish people who didn't practice as bodhisattvas and called themselves bodhisattvas.

source_sentence: 在諸菩薩凶堅自用，分別經典，侏[仁-二+張]匿功，獨謂己達，以為二行。
translation: Among the bodhisattvas, they were fierce and resolute in their own ways, discriminated the scriptures, and considered themselves to have attained them alone, thinking that they had two practices.

source_sentence: 常自說言：『此人何知？
translation: He always says to himself, 'How does this person know?'

source_sentence: 此何所解。』」
translation: What is the understanding of this?'"

source_sentence: 佛告彌勒：「我身現在所宣頌教，行佛道時布施頭、目、支體、肌肉、妻子、國邑，佛悉識念，以一頌故布施天下。
translation: The Buddha told Maitreya, "I myself now proclaim the teaching of praise, and when I practice the Buddha's way, I give alms to heads, eyes, limbs, muscles, wives, and countries, and the Buddha is fully aware of that, and I give alms to the whole world because of one verse.

source_sentence: 是等愚惑求獲利養，不往敬佛、宣道教者，不隨佛教，違失道節。」
translation: Such foolish people who seek gain and profit and don't go out to honor the Buddha and proclaim the teaching of the Way don't follow Buddhism and violate the rules of the Way."

source_sentence: 佛言：「阿逸！
translation: The Buddha said, "Ayi!

source_sentence: 當以清和可奉此法，不以諍訟。
translation: This is a teaching that should be served in a pure and peaceful way, not with arguments.

source_sentence: 「阿逸！
translation: "Ayi!

source_sentence: 且觀此黨眾生習隨瑕疵，發起瞋恚，不熟思惟識達義故也。
translation: "Furthermore, they observe that these sentient beings are accustomed to following imperfections, become angry, and aren't ripe for contemplating and understanding the meaning.

source_sentence: 如吾所修成最正覺，宣傳佛慧而為說法，便當說言：『莫傳此教，於彼世時利供養故。』
translation: As I have cultivated the most correct awakening, I'll publicize the Buddha's wisdom and preach it, and then I'll say, 'Don't transmit this teaching; it's for the benefit of offerings in other times.'

source_sentence: 其法比丘講說方等千餘經卷，興發四禪，因是乃致如此艱難。
translation: That Dharma monk's explanation of the thousand or so sūtras and scrolls that inspire the four meditations has caused such difficulty.

source_sentence: 何況妄說違失義理，不順道教？
translation: How could it be that he was speaking falsely and incorrectly about the meaning and principle and not following the teaching of the Way?

source_sentence: 「若有比丘奉方等教、宣方等藏，故發道心，反更興心誹謗法師，則為誹謗諸佛經典，甚懷慢恣求其瑕缺。
translation: "If a monk who has dedicated himself to the balanced teaching and declared the balanced collection and thus aroused the intention to follow the path instead becomes motivated to denigrate the teacher of the Dharma, that would be denigrating the sutras of the Buddha and harboring great pride and wantonness in seeking their flaws.

source_sentence: 佛不謂此得至究竟盡生死源，是等之類必墮地獄。
translation: The Buddha doesn't say that this will lead to the ultimate ending of the source of birth-and-death, and such people will surely fall into hell.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 若有求取法師短者，則為慊佛、患厭經法；其輕法師則不敬佛。
translation: If someone seeks to get the short end of the stick from a teacher of the Dharma, they're dissatisfied with the Buddha and suffer from disillusionment with the sūtras and the Dharma, and they despise the teacher of the Dharma and don't respect the Buddha.

source_sentence: 若不欲覩於法師者，其人則為不欲見佛；若毀法師，為毀諸佛。
translation: If someone doesn't want to see the teacher of the Dharma, they don't want to see the Buddha, and if they disparage the teacher of the Dharma, they disparage the buddhas.

source_sentence: 若興害心念初發意菩薩惡者，從其發心害意，諸無數劫若干劫失其道意；以其惡眼視菩薩數，更若干世世世生盲；從本字數口宣誹謗說法師惡，更若干劫瘖瘂無舌。」
translation: If someone becomes harmful in mind and thinks of the evils of the bodhisattvas who first arouse their minds, they'll lose their intention for the path for many incalculable eons and eons as they arouse their minds to harm; they'll become blind for many more generations as they look at the number of bodhisattvas with their evil eyes; and they'll denigrate the Dharma teacher and speak evil of him from their lips for many more eons as they become dumb and tongueless."

source_sentence: 佛告阿逸：「佛普觀察，見諸菩薩不因餘法速墮惡趣，惟由惡心向餘菩薩。
translation: The Buddha told Ayi, "The Buddha generally observes and sees that bodhisattvas don't quickly fall into a bad destiny because of other teachings, but only because of bad thoughts toward other bodhisattvas.

source_sentence: 想吾我人貪住求法，故墮惡趣。」
translation: Imagine that we, as human beings, are addicted to seeking the Dharma and therefore fall into a bad destiny."

source_sentence: 佛言：「阿逸！
translation: The Buddha said, "Ayi!

source_sentence: 如來不謂宣傳經典隨顛倒教、念在生死自恣放逸、住我人想行若干法，為是菩薩。
translation: The Tathāgata doesn't consider it a bodhisattva who promotes the sūtras, follows mistaken teachings, is mindful of birth-and-death, is careless, and abides in certain conceptions and practices of self and person.

source_sentence: 因是之故，故墮地獄。
translation: Because of this, they'll fall into hell.

source_sentence: 是故，阿逸！
translation: Therefore, Āyatollah!

source_sentence: 菩薩遵習六波羅蜜，能成佛慧無上正真。
translation: By following the six perfections, a bodhisattva can achieve the unsurpassed correctness of Buddha's wisdom.

source_sentence: 「或有愚人口自宣言：『菩薩惟當學般若波羅蜜，其餘經者非波羅蜜，說其乏短。』
translation: "Perhaps some foolish person mouths the statement, 'A bodhisattva should only train in the perfection of wisdom; the other sūtras are not perfections and are said to be lacking in it.'

source_sentence: 於阿逸意所趣云何？
translation: What's the aim of Ajñātaśatru's mind?

source_sentence: 本時國王所以持頭施與人者，為無智乎？」
translation: Was the king ignorant when he gave the head to the people?"

source_sentence: 彌勒答曰：「不也。
translation: Maitreya replied, "No.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 佛本所修六波羅蜜，所為至誠真實行乎。」
translation: What are the six perfections originally cultivated by the Buddha, which are most sincerely and truly practiced?"

source_sentence: 「為不行是得佛道耶？」
translation: "Why isn't this the way to attain the Buddhahood?"

source_sentence: 彌勒報曰：「不也。
translation: Maitreya replied, "No.

source_sentence: 世尊！」
translation: Bhagavān!"

source_sentence: 佛語阿逸：「仁本宿世具六十劫行檀波羅蜜、尸羼惟逮，所修禪定、般若波羅蜜亦復如是，各六十劫。
translation: The Buddha said to Ayi, "In his past life, Ren had practiced the perfection of giving and the perfection of śrāvaka for 60 eons, and he likewise cultivated the perfection of meditation and wisdom for 60 eons each.

source_sentence: 而愚憃等各自發言：『當以一品行般若波羅蜜至於佛道。』
translation: But foolish foolish people each said, 'One should practice the perfection of wisdom in one class to reach the Buddha Way.'

source_sentence: 奉隨顛倒，無所慕樂。
translation: They follow their mistaken attachments and have no desire for them.

source_sentence: 是等之類雖口有言，行不清白；虛言反教，常行猗著；悕望於空，不肯作行。
translation: Although these kinds of people speak with their mouths, their actions aren't pure; they speak false words and teach otherwise; they always conduct themselves with reluctance; they long for emptiness, and they refuse to conduct themselves.

source_sentence: 但口發言以為第一，雖行甚遠貪妬懷嫉、敬重種姓親屬知識，吾本寧以頭施於人，不用轉輪聖王之位。
translation: Although they speak with their mouths and think they're the best, and although their actions are far-reaching, they're greedy and jealous, and they revere their caste and relatives and friends, we'd originally give our heads to people and not take the position of wheel-turning sage king.

source_sentence: 斯等貪著衣食利養，入他家居當說此言：『行道如是。
translation: Such people are so desirous of clothing, food, and profit that they would enter another person's home and say, 'Thus is the path of practice.'

source_sentence: 如是行者，其理如是，無復異義。』
translation: Such is the principle of someone who thus practices, and there's no different meaning.'

source_sentence: 多有法師不了斯教，利供養故，多生害意，念法師惡。」
translation: Many Dharma masters don't understand this teaching, and because of their profitable offerings, they often become harmful and think badly of their Dharma masters."

source_sentence: 佛言：「阿逸！
translation: The Buddha said, "Ayi!

source_sentence: 佛不以是貪愛其命、無道愚夫為學道也，正使百劫不得柔順法忍也，況當獲致至佛道乎？」
translation: The Buddha doesn't regard such a desirous, wayward fool as a trainee on the path, which precisely prevents him from attaining the forbearance of the flexible Dharma for a hundred eons, so how could he attain the Buddhahood?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「阿逸！

source_sentence: 行諛諂者，悋惜貪嫉，不行恭敬，無有明智，懷妬種姓，造二品行為求道也。
translation: Those who practice flattery are those who are stingy, greedy, unrespectful, lack wisdom, and harbor seeds, creating two kinds of conduct in pursuit of the path.

source_sentence: 斯愚人等自謂智明想勝佛慧。
translation: Such foolish people claim to have wisdom and insight that's superior to the Buddha's wisdom.

source_sentence: 所以然者，橫自發言：『如來說法言辭不爾。
translation: That's why they say, 'The Tathāgata explains the teaching in words that are not like that.

source_sentence: 是聲聞事，佛亦不說聲聞之法。』」
translation: It's a matter for śrāvakas, and the Buddha doesn't teach the śrāvaka teachings.'"

source_sentence: 爾時，佛告賢者須菩提：「般若波羅蜜其原為一無二行乎？」
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed the good man Subhūti, "Is the original practice of prajñā-pāramitā one and not two?"

source_sentence: 須菩提白曰：「唯然，天中天！」
translation: Subhūti said, "Yes, god of gods!"

source_sentence: 又問：「須菩提！
translation: Again, he asked, "Subhūti!

source_sentence: 菩薩所行捨眾望想無所著乎？」
translation: What do bodhisattvas practice, which is to abandon expectations and conceptions and attach to nothing?"

source_sentence: 「唯然，世尊！」
translation: "Yes, Bhagavān!"

source_sentence: 復問：「須菩提！
translation: Again, he asked, "Subhūti!

source_sentence: 菩薩所修棄諸馳騁無放逸乎？」
translation: What do bodhisattvas cultivate, abandoning all kinds of hustle and non-frivolity?"

source_sentence: 「唯然，世尊！」
translation: "Yes, Bhagavān!"

source_sentence: 佛告須菩提：「豈見學士，己不自修，不知羞慚。
translation: The Buddha told Subhūti, "Do you see a bachelor who doesn't cultivate himself and doesn't know shame?

source_sentence: 欲得希望功勳之報，當致貧厄；欲求勢姓慕得援助，何甚愚哉！」
translation: To wish for the reward of merit would lead to poverty and distress, and to seek the aid of powerful families would be foolish!"

source_sentence: 佛復告阿逸：「菩薩假使聞說一切諸法皆聲聞法，不當恐怖。
translation: The Buddha again told Ayi, "Suppose a bodhisattva hears and teaches that all things are śrāvaka teachings, and he's not afraid.

source_sentence: 一切諸法皆緣覺法、一切諸法皆為佛法，不當恐怖。
translation: It wouldn't be frightening to learn that all things are pratyekabuddha dharmas and all things are Buddha dharmas.

source_sentence: 莫懷悕望，有所猗著。
translation: Don't harbor expectations and become attached to them.

source_sentence: 一切諸法皆凡夫法、一切諸法皆塵勞法，設聞是言，不當恐怖；一切諸法皆瞋恚法、一切諸法無瞋恨法，設聞是言，不當恐怖。
translation: It's not frightening to hear that all things are worldlings' dharmas and all things are defiled dharmas, and it's not frightening to hear that all things are anger dharmas and all things are non-angry dharmas.

source_sentence: 若有所受、若無所受，作與不作，覆、不覆，清、不清，有心、無心，有念、無念，有罪、無罪，有福、無福，有報、無報，有安、無安，有脫、無脫，精進、懈怠，有行、無行，修賢聖法、無賢聖法，寂然、不寂然，受與不受，至誠、虛詐，順念、不順念，住與不住，於此諸法永無所畏。
translation: If there is feeling and no feeling, doing and not doing, covering and not covering, clarity and not clarity, presence and absence of mind, mindfulness and absence of mindfulness, guilt and absence of guilt, merit and absence of merit, reward and absence of reward, security and absence of security, liberation and absence of liberation, diligence and laziness, practice and absence of practice, cultivation of noble qualities and absence of noble qualities, stillness and absence of stillness, feeling and not feeling, sincerity and deceit, agreeable and disagreeable mindfulness, abiding and abiding, there's never any fear in these things.

source_sentence: 「佛本學時，在佛樹下，所達諸法成最正覺，暢解一切眾生境界，悉無顛倒曉了諸法，皆為自然不著無處。
translation: "When the Buddha was first training, under the buddha tree, he attained supreme perfect enlightenment in regard to the things he understood, fully understood the sphere of all sentient beings, and comprehended all things without confusion, so that they were all naturally unattached and without a place.

source_sentence: 故為世人分別說此如來至真不名諸法，亦無所諍。
translation: That's why they discerned for the world that the Tathāgata's ultimate truth wasn't called any dharmas, and there was no debate about it.

source_sentence: 菩薩以故逮致聖光無極法曜，興發總持稱舉法印，為諸法故，無所上下。」
translation: Because of this, the bodhisattva acquires the holy radiance and limitless Dharma radiance, arouses the general maintenance, praises, and sets forth the seal of the Dharma, and for the sake of the dharmas, there's no up or down."

source_sentence: 佛語阿逸：「佛以法故，為四方域頒宣經道。
translation: The Buddha said to Ayi, "It's because of the Dharma that the Buddha promulgates the sūtras and paths for the four regions.

source_sentence: 眾生各念：『如來為我如是比類演出經義。』
translation: Each of the sentient beings thinks, 'The Tathāgata thus explains the sūtras' meanings for me in this way.'

source_sentence: 至二十四阿加膩吒天。
translation: They reached the twenty-four Akaniṣṭha heavens.

source_sentence: 次復開化第二方域至二十四天。
translation: Next, he enlightened a second region up to the twenty-four heavens.

source_sentence: 三千大千世界亦復如是，眾生皆念：『如來生此而轉法輪、講說經法。』
translation: Similarly, in the 3,000 great one-thousand worlds, sentient beings each think, 'The Tathāgata was born here, turned the wheel of the Dharma, and explained the teachings of the sūtras.'

source_sentence: 如是比像無數方便，至無央數無際世界開化眾生。
translation: Thus, the Buddha's countless skillful means reach measureless and limitless worlds to enlighten sentient beings.

source_sentence: 「吾於明旦所周旋處，興作佛事不可限量；日中晡時亦復如是。
translation: "There's no limit to the number of places I'll go around on sunrise to perform Buddhist works, and the same goes for midday and afternoon.

source_sentence: 如來至真常爾不廢，目無蔽礙，普見一切眾生境界。
translation: The Tathāgata's supreme truth remains eternal and unimpeded, and his eyes are unobstructed, universally seeing the sphere of all sentient beings.

source_sentence: 一切佛土如是無限，諸佛部界其亦然矣。
translation: As all buddha-lands are thus infinite, so are the Buddha's sects and realms.

source_sentence: 「菩薩皆當學如此義，住在諸法妄想之處而開化之。
translation: "Bodhisattvas should all train in this doctrine, abiding in the place of false conceptions of things and enlightening them.

source_sentence: 其住諸佛有所悕望，則已住在誹謗諸佛；其已住在誹謗諸佛，彼則住在墮於嶮路；其墮嶮路則墮惡趣，其住惡趣則住諸法諍訟之處。
translation: When they abide expecting buddhas, they'll abide denigrating buddhas; when they abide denigrating buddhas, they'll abide falling into a dangerous path; when they fall into a dangerous path, they'll fall into a bad destiny, and when they abide in a bad destiny, they'll abide in a place of dispute over qualities.

source_sentence: 是故，阿逸！

translation: You must protect the Tathāgata's skillful means, for the Buddha himself will explain this teaching at any time."

source_sentence: 於是，文殊師利告趣聚福菩薩、不虛見菩薩、一辯心菩薩、善了說心菩薩、訶辯菩薩、喜王菩薩、離怨毛竪無畏行菩薩、心願無量佛土菩薩、光世音菩薩、眾香手菩薩、除諸陰蓋菩薩、不置遠菩薩、合百千德菩薩、威神音菩薩、心不捨諸慧菩薩、宣名稱英幢菩薩、念求諸義菩薩、行不離佛界菩薩、超月殿威灼灼菩薩、嚴諸大界菩薩。
translation: 於是，文殊師利告趣聚福菩薩、不虛見菩薩、一辯心菩薩、善了說心菩薩、訶辯菩薩、喜王菩薩、離怨毛竪無畏行菩薩、心願無量佛土菩薩、光世音菩薩、眾香手菩薩、除諸陰蓋菩薩、不置遠菩薩、合百千德菩薩、威神音菩薩、心不捨諸慧菩薩、宣名稱英幢菩薩、念求諸義菩薩、行不離佛界菩薩、超月殿威灼灼菩薩、嚴諸大界菩薩。

source_sentence: 文殊師利告於此等二十菩薩，復白佛言：「如是，如是！
translation: Mañjuśrī told these 20 bodhisattvas and again said to the Buddha, "So it is!

source_sentence: 吾詣東方過是六十江沙諸佛剎土，禮諸世尊，聞所說法，亦如今日；西、南、北佛土、四維、上、下亦復如是。
translation: I went east to 60 rivers and sands of buddha-places, paid homage to the Bhagavān, and heard the teaching given this very day; so did the western, southern, and northern buddha-places, the four counterpoints, and the upper and lower [realms].

source_sentence: 遊觀七日轉復前行，不見餘佛。
translation: He wandered around for seven days, resumed his journey, and didn't see any other buddhas.

source_sentence: 尋復還反，來至此土稽首聽經。」
translation: He then returned and came to this land to bow his head and listen to the sūtras."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告文殊師利：「仁且觀此如來聖慧無量。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed Mañjuśrī, "Sir, you should observe that the Tathāgata's noble wisdom is immeasurable.

source_sentence: 若茲諸佛境界不可思議，巍巍如是；如來所入等無有侶，靡不周悉。
translation: The buddha-realms here are unfathomable and lofty, and there are no companions such as the one the Tathāgata enters, which are not completely comprehensible.

source_sentence: 或有愚騃不識義理，趣自說言：『般若波羅蜜如來所行，是諸如來無極修教，餘經皆非佛語。』
translation: Some foolish people don't understand the meaning and principle and go ahead and say, 'The prajñāpāramitā that the Tathāgata practices is the teaching of the Tathāgata's infinite cultivation, and the other sūtras are not the words of the Buddha.'

source_sentence: 「文殊！
translation: "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 菩薩行者無合會行，乃是開士正真之行。
translation: "A bodhisattva's practice is without confluence, and it's the true practice of the enlightened one.

source_sentence: 無等倫行則菩薩行，無所受行為菩薩行，無所著行亦無不著是菩薩行。
translation: Bodhisattva practice without equanimous practice, bodhisattva practice without acquired behavior, and bodhisattva practice without attachment and without non-attachment are bodhisattva practices.

source_sentence: 如是，文殊！
translation: Thus, Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 菩薩所行為無輕慢，吾以隨時分別宣說。
translation: "What bodhisattvas do is not to be taken lightly, and I explain it by discerning it at any time.

source_sentence: 諸法難見亦難曉了。
translation: All things are difficult to see and difficult to comprehend.

source_sentence: 是故，文殊！
translation: Therefore, Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 諸賢一切當修寂然無放逸行，順從正士堅固之行，常懷慈心不為瞋害。
translation: "Good men, all of you should cultivate the practice of stillness and nonfrivolity, follow the resolute actions of righteous people, and always be compassionate and not harmful to anger.

source_sentence: 以住諸法修等行者，則從佛教。
translation: Those who cultivate the same practices with the support of these things then follow Buddhism.

source_sentence: 「佛無數劫遵習此道，以權方便而頒宣之。
translation: "The Buddha has followed this path for countless eons and has taught it by expedient means.

source_sentence: 有無智人各懷異意，墮大艱難，當興譏謗、謗訕經道：『非如來所宣。』
translation: If there are unwise people who have different ideas and fall into great difficulty, they will criticize and denigrate the sūtras and say, 'They're not proclaimed by the Tathāgata.'

source_sentence: 毀呰法者不覺微失，坐不護口。
translation: Those who disparage the teaching don't realize the slightest loss, and they sit there without guarding their mouths.

source_sentence: 或自心念：『是事嘉快，或謂不快。』
translation: Some may think to themselves, 'This is something pleasant, or it might be called unpleasant.'

source_sentence: 故誹謗法。
translation: Therefore, they denigrate the Dharma.

source_sentence: 以誹謗法，則誹謗佛；已誹謗佛，則毀聖眾。
translation: Because they denigrate the Dharma, they denigrate the Buddha, and having denigrated the Buddha, they disparage the noble people.

source_sentence: 「口橫說言：『是事為應、是事不應。』
translation: "They say flatly, 'This is something that should be, and this is something that shouldn't be.'

source_sentence: 如是言者，為誹謗法。
translation: Such words denigrate the Dharma.

source_sentence: 「『為諸菩薩講說此事、為諸聲聞演如是教。』
translation: " 'Explaining this matter for the bodhisattvas and teaching it like this for the śrāvakas.'

source_sentence: 口說此言為誹謗法。
translation: Saying this verbally is a denigration of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 「『諸菩薩等當學此法、當捨此法、不當習學也。』
translation: "'Bodhisattvas should learn this teaching, should abandon this teaching, and should not train in it.'

source_sentence: 妄說如此，為誹謗法。
translation: To say this falsely is to denigrate the Dharma.

source_sentence: 「『某有辯才、某不辯才，某性便利、某性訥鈍。』
translation: "'Someone has eloquence, someone doesn't have eloquence, and someone is skillful by nature and dull by nature.'

source_sentence: 妄有譏訶，說經如是，為誹謗法。
translation: To falsely criticize someone and teach a sūtra like this is to denigrate the Dharma.

source_sentence: 「若以宣言：『值佛世時，可得總持；不值佛世，不得總持。』
translation: "If someone declares, 'When they're in the Buddha's lifetime, they can maintain it; when they're not in the Buddha's lifetime, they can't maintain it.'

source_sentence: 為誹謗法。
translation: This is a denigrating teaching.

source_sentence: 「『雖以修行逮得總持，所逮總持未必清淨。』
translation: "'Even though I may have attained the mastery through cultivation, the mastery I've attained may not be pure.'

source_sentence: 若說如是，為誹謗法。
translation: If someone says this, it's a denigrating dharma.

source_sentence: 「求法師短，瞻其法則、所行缺漏，為誹謗法。
translation: "Seeking a Dharma teacher who's short and looking at the deficiencies in his principles and practices is a denigrating dharma.

source_sentence: 「不信法師所行具足、假使法師不應威儀，為誹謗法。
translation: "To disbelieve that a Dharma teacher's conduct is complete and to assume that a Dharma teacher isn't well-behaved is a denigrating dharma.

source_sentence: 「宣於法師放逸之業，馳騁由己不能專一，為誹謗法。
translation: "Proclaiming that a teacher of the Dharma is careless in his actions, roaming about on his own and unable to focus is a denigration of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 「禮節不備、失經違節，非所奉戒，擾擾凶凶，則誹謗法。
translation: "To be unproficient in propriety, to lose the restraint of the sūtras, to violate the precepts that aren't well-ordered, and to disturb someone fierce is to denigrate the Dharma.

source_sentence: 「有所宣義理，其明不廣，妄有所講，為誹謗法。
translation: "When someone proclaims a principle that's not explained in detail, they falsely explain it, which is a slanderous teaching.

source_sentence: 「言語不了，辯才不暢，欲傳道教，為誹謗法。
translation: "When someone doesn't speak well and doesn't have the eloquence to explain things well, they want to teach the Way, which is a slanderous teaching.

source_sentence: 「本學不勤，所知甚尠，明不廣遠，欲宣道教，為誹謗法。
translation: "When someone hasn't studied hard enough, has little knowledge, and their insight isn't extensive, their desire to proclaim the teaching of the Way is a slanderous teaching.

source_sentence: 「心自念言：『某不知限、不了隨時，當教開化，達令至義。』
translation: "They think to themselves, 'I don't know the limits and don't understand them at any time, so I'll teach and enlighten them to achieve their ultimate goal.'

source_sentence: 為誹謗法。
translation: This is a denigrating dharma.

source_sentence: 「興發想念，不護佛教，懷抱危害，為誹謗法。
translation: "To arouse longing, not protect Buddhism, and harbor harm is a denigrating dharma.

source_sentence: 「各獲一卷文字經教，各是所學諍義失義，為誹謗法。
translation: "To obtain a scroll of scriptural teaching that disputes the meaning and misses the point of what each has learned is a slanderous act.

source_sentence: 「各頌一偈，諍其義理，自說是非，為誹謗法。
translation: "To recite a verse each, debate its meaning, and declare right and wrong on one's own is a slanderous act.

source_sentence: 「『某有信樂、某不篤道，某當得脫、某不得脫。』
translation: "'If someone has faith and happiness, or if someone doesn't follow the path, someone will be liberated, and someone won't be liberated.'

source_sentence: 為誹謗法。
translation: This is a denigrating verse.

source_sentence: 「若講法時，所言各異，反其義理非某所講，故來亂坐談語說事，為誹謗法。
translation: "If someone speaks differently when the teaching is given, saying something contrary to what's being taught that's not the teaching of a certain person, and they therefore come to sit in confusion, talk, and explain things, that's a denigrating dharma.

source_sentence: 「『是人應行、是不應行，某為隨順、某不隨順。』
translation: "'This is someone who should practice and this is someone who shouldn't practice, and this is someone who follows and this is someone who doesn't follow.'

source_sentence: 為誹謗法。
translation: This is a denigrating dharma.

source_sentence: 「『某以隨時、某不知時。』
translation: "'A certain person acts at an appropriate time and a certain person doesn't know the time.'

source_sentence: 違失義理，不從道節，為誹謗法。」
translation: To go against the truth and not follow the rules of the path is to denigrate the Dharma."

source_sentence: 佛告文殊師利：「諸聲聞眾有所懷裹分別說者、諸菩薩等聰明辯才有所頒宣，皆承如來威神聖旨。」
translation: The Buddha told Mañjuśrī, "Those śrāvakas who discern what's in their hearts and those bodhisattvas who are intelligent and eloquent enough to proclaim it are all indebted to the Tathāgata's authoritative power and noble will."

source_sentence: 佛言：「文殊！
translation: The Buddha said, "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 如來道教隨時之宜，所誓如是。
translation: The Tathāgata's teaching of the way is appropriate at all times, and it's thus vowed.

source_sentence: 斯等愚夫唯念毀呰，求其長短、不從佛教、反非如來、所念法師而譏謗之，是等悉為魔之所亂。
translation: Such foolish people are only mindful of disparagement, seek their length, don't follow Buddhism, and denigrate teachers other than the Tathāgata and those they miss, and they are all disturbed by Māra.

source_sentence: 猗求利養故發此意，當歸惡趣。
translation: They will go to a bad destiny because they have this intention of seeking profit.

source_sentence: 將護居家所依善厚，反不慎護住如來教，猗其尊勢有勢位者、王者、長者、梵志。
translation: They'll guard the good and generous bases of their homes, but they won't guard the Tathāgata's teaching carefully, and they'll be concerned about their venerable position as a powerful man, king, elder, or priest.

source_sentence: 若使有人難問義者誦說義理，咸共嘆言：『善說此事。
translation: If someone who has difficulty asking about the meaning recites and explains the principle, they all praise it, saying, 'This is a good teaching.'

source_sentence: 所知嘉快，如佛所說；所可頒宣，極有義理。』
translation: What they know is commendable and enjoyable, just as the Buddha taught, and what can be proclaimed is quite purposeful.'

source_sentence: 僉然勸助、由是勸助，墮誹謗法。
translation: They all encouraged and assisted each other, and this encouragement led to the denigration of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 同等群黨出入進退，然後沒已，俱墮惡趣。」
translation: After going in and out with the same group, they all go back and forth, and then they all fall into a bad destiny after being forsaken."

source_sentence: 佛復告文殊師利：「若有菩薩猗著諸行，我不謂此為菩薩也。」
translation: The Buddha again told Mañjuśrī, "If a bodhisattva becomes absorbed in various practices, I wouldn't call that a bodhisattva."

source_sentence: 佛言：「阿逸！
translation: The Buddha said, "Ayatollah!

source_sentence: 其依種姓有豪居位，佛不謂此為清淨也。
translation: They have powerful families who live in positions based on their lineage, but the Buddha doesn't say that's pure.

source_sentence: 其有宣傳兩品經義，言行各異，佛不謂此當得解脫，必歸地獄。
translation: If someone were to promote the meanings of two classes of sūtras and say and do different things, the Buddha wouldn't say that this would lead to liberation and would surely lead to hell.

source_sentence: 假使有人專一品說，謂義趣是莫能過者，佛不謂此越度惡趣眾患之難。
translation: If someone were to focus on one class of teaching and say that there's no way to go beyond the path of righteousness, the Buddha wouldn't say that it's a transcendence of the difficulties of the many hardships of a bad destiny.

source_sentence: 其多辭說樂於眾閙，佛不謂此應清白行。」
translation: They often say they're happy with the bell ringing, but the Buddha doesn't say that they should conduct themselves in a pure way."

source_sentence: 佛語文殊：「佛所頒宣理諸顛倒，進退法門如江沙等；所宣法門樂著空者，其數多少亦如江沙；為諸妄想而計有人宣法門教，其限多少亦如江沙。
translation: The Buddha said to Mañjuśrī, "The principles that the Buddha promulgates are mistaken, and the methods of advance and retreat are like rivers and sands; the number of those who are happy to be attached to emptiness in the Dharma teachings they proclaim is also like rivers and sands; and the number of those who are limited by the teachings of the Dharma teachings they proclaim for deluded conceptions is also like rivers and sands.

source_sentence: 眾生亦如無想之業、諸有想原，無願之業、諸有願本，為說法門亦如江沙。
translation: All sentient beings are like the karma of absence of ideation and the origin of those ideations, and the karma of absence of desire and the origin of those desires, which are like rivers and sands when the Dharma teaching is proclaimed for them.

source_sentence: 有人、無人，有命、無命，有壽、無壽，有欲、無欲，有貪、無貪，有為、無為，某人慇懃隨從計常、某不慇懃但念斷滅，是樂隨俗、是為度世，某貪欲門、某瞋恚門、某樂癡門，如來皆使除此諸門，故說法門矣。」
translation: Whether there are people or no people, lives or no lives, lives or no lives, desires or no desires, cravings or no cravings, behaviors or no behaviors, people who are attentive and follow mistaken constancy, people who aren't attentive but think about cessation, people who enjoy following conventionality and people who are aiming to save the world, people who have the gate of desire, people who have the gate of anger, and people who enjoy the gate of delusion, the Tathāgata makes it possible to remove these gates and therefore explain the Dharma teaching."

source_sentence: 佛語文殊：「若有修行平等之宜永無所著，一切皆應般若波羅蜜教。
translation: The Buddha said to Mañjuśrī, "If it's appropriate to cultivate equality and never attach to anything, they should all be taught by the perfection of wisdom.

source_sentence: 若有講說慧各各異，心在見聞，演不如慧，則謗如來也。」
translation: If there's a difference between preaching and wisdom, or if the mind is seeing and hearing and preaching isn't wisdom, then you're denigrating the Tathāgata."

source_sentence: 於是，文殊師利復問佛言：「唯然，世尊！
translation: Mañjuśrī then again asked the Buddha, "Yes, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 此等之類為從惡友誤啟受教，乃能興發如是譏謗。
translation: These kinds of people are capable of producing such slander because they've been misinformed and taught by bad friends.

source_sentence: 以何方便現世自責能除罪法？」
translation: What method does self-reproach in the present life use to remove the sinful qualities?"

translation: The Bhagavān then told Mañjuśrī, "Suppose this person repents and rebukes himself three times a day and three times a night for seven years, and then he'll be able to remove the slander he's created and subtly digest it.

source_sentence: 當復曾更十五劫行乃逮法忍。」
translation: It would then have been another fifteen eons of practice before he had acquired the tolerance of the Dharma."

source_sentence: 菩薩習此經典之要，不能曉了而妄宣傳。
translation: Bodhisattvas study the essentials of this sūtra, but they don't understand them and falsely proclaim them.

source_sentence: 欲解其事甚難得度，文字之法散義不暢。
translation: It's very difficult to get through to someone who wants to understand its content, and the words of the teaching are loose and don't make sense.

source_sentence: 是故，菩薩先善諦學然後能宣，如是學者不自傷損。」
translation: Therefore, a bodhisattva first learns it well and then is able to proclaim it, so that the learner doesn't harm himself."

source_sentence: 佛言：「文殊！
translation: The Buddha said, "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 菩薩有四法曉了諸行。
translation: Bodhisattvas have four ways of understanding their actions.

source_sentence: 何謂為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 一曰、等心愍於眾生，二曰、等解諸法而無偏黨，三曰、等於道義不猗邪正，四曰、所說平等不懷妄想，是為四。
translation: 1. equal concern for sentient beings, 2. equal understanding of dharmas without partiality, 3. equal adherence to the meaning of the path without discriminating between right and wrong, and 4. equality in what's taught without harboring false notions are four.

source_sentence: 若不解此四平等，妄有所說，則自傷損。
translation: If someone doesn't understand these four kinds of equality and speaks about them falsely, they will be harmed.

source_sentence: 「若族姓子及族姓女逮住四法，不自傷損。
translation: "If clansmen and clanswomen grasp these four things, they won't harm themselves.

source_sentence: 何謂為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 一曰、不懷害心加於眾生，二曰、不與法師而共諍訟，三曰、己身少明不毀他人博達慧者，四曰、心自念言：『此一切義皆佛所說，故當敬奉謙下恭順。』
translation: 1. they don't inflict harm on sentient beings, 2. they don't engage in disputes with teachers of the Dharma, 3. they don't disparage others with their own little knowledge, and 4. they think to themselves, 'All these things are taught by the Buddha, so I must respect and humble myself and submit to them.'

source_sentence: 是為四法不自傷損。」
translation: These are the four things that don't harm themselves."

source_sentence: 佛言：「文殊！
translation: The Buddha said, "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 若有菩薩於江河沙諸佛剎土滿中七寶，如江沙劫一切供養十方諸佛，日日各爾，布施奉佛而不休息。
translation: "Suppose there's a bodhisattva who makes offerings to the buddhas of the ten directions from a river and sands of buddha bases filled with seven treasures, like a river and sands eon, and each day goes by without resting as he gives alms to the buddhas.

source_sentence: 若復受此濟方等學經典之要，書著竹帛一返宣說，其福過彼供養諸佛。
translation: If he were to accept this teaching, write it down on bamboo and silk, and then explain it to them, his merit would be greater than that of making offerings to the buddhas.

source_sentence: 所以然者，布施、持戒、忍辱、精進、一心、智慧，皆不能及斯人善業。
translation: That's why generosity, observance of precepts, patience, diligence, single-mindedness, and wisdom are all incapable of matching this person's good actions.

source_sentence: 濟方等學經典之要，菩薩學是德無等倫，獨步無侶。」
translation: They help people in various directions to learn the essentials of the scriptures, and the bodhisattva's study of them has unequalled virtue and is unparalleled."

source_sentence: 說是經時，三十江河沙等菩薩皆悉得無所從生法忍、七十江河沙等菩薩普悉得立不退轉地——當成無上正真之道、六十億姟百千眾人生在於此三千大千國者聞是經典，咸共勸助悉發道意，僉然意解越八十劫生死之難，亦皆一時得不退轉。
translation: When this sūtra was spoken, 30 rivers and sands of bodhisattvas all attained the patience of the Dharma that arises from nothing, 70 rivers and sands of bodhisattvas all attained the stage of nonretrogression - that is, they would achieve the unsurpassed true path - and 6 billion or 100,000,000 people born in these 3,000,000 countries who heard this sūtra were all encouraged and helped to give rise to the intention to follow the path, and they all had the intention to transcend the difficulty of 80 eons of birth-and-death and attain nonretrogression at once.

source_sentence: 佛說如是。
translation: The Buddha said it was like this.

source_sentence: 諸比丘及菩薩，一切眾會——天、龍、鬼神、犍沓惒、阿須倫、世間人民——聞佛所說，莫不歡喜，作禮而去。
translation: The monks, bodhisattvas, and all the assembled people - gods, dragons, spirits, gandharvas, asuras, and people of the world - who heard what the Buddha taught rejoiced, paid homage, and departed.

translation: Sutra on Relieving All Learners
